sentences.sContent: I became heavily involved in politics.
The report was heavily criticized in the press.
sentences.sCn: 该报道遭到了新闻界的严厉批评。
全副武装的数千人的部队

sentences.sContent: His wife was heavily pregnant at the time.
...like the heavily jewel-covered “eggs” that were favored by the Russians starting in the 19th century...

...Parents and students who have invested heavily in higher education worry about graduates' job prospects as technological advances and changes in domestic and global markets transform professions in ways that reduce wages and cut jobs...
...developers borrowed heavily and built bigger and fancier hotels as if the whole world were planning a holiday in Las Vegas...
...Many people are borrowing on credit cards so heavily that payoff rates at these levels are not sufficient to recover their credit card debt by the end of their life...

words.tran: 沉重的；繁重的，巨大的；阴沉的
沉重；沉闷；笨拙；迟钝；忧伤

trans.tranOther: in large amounts, to a high degree, or with great severity
